!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 376 Jun 23, 2004 22:22:25.307
!MESSAGE Marker id: 3748856 not found.

We now only log the exception if we get an exception but marker.exists() 
returns true. Either the marker still exists but cannot be found or was 
deleted and recreated in a very short period of time. John, are marker ids 
reused in such a case? Any other ideas what might be happening?

There are no side-effects to this warning. Markers can be removed between the
time an event is generated and the decoration occurs. 

Michael, why even bother to log these cases? I know we discussed this and you
felt that it shouldn't happen, but it does. It may be that marker.exists() can
return true for phantom resources?

Re comment #1 - marker ids are represented as a long, and will only be reused if
we wrap the long counter (hint: that would be a lot of markers).
Then how could the call to get attribute fail but the marker still exist?

There is unfortunately no scheduling rule that can protect you from concurrent
deletion of the marker in another thread.

John and I have looked at the code and it does not appear possible for this 
exception to happen. Are you running on a dual-processor machine?
I'd love to. No. It's a T30.

Forgive me if this is unrelated, but a similar message is showing up repeatedly
in my Error Log view.  It is usually, but perhaps not always, occurring when I
double-click on a compile error in the Problems view.  Is this the same bug?

Re: Comment #8: It is unlikely that this is the same bug. Please open a 
separate bug report against Platform UI.

As for this bug, the code in question will only log an error if the marker 
cannot be found but does exist. I could change the code to eat the exception 
but this could hide a valid error in the future. Therefore, I'm marking this as 
wontfix. If you see this again, feel free to reopen.
